meanings.sent1: The immixture of colors created a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: She carefully observed the immixture of ingredients in the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The immixture of laughter and music filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: In the immixture of emotions, she found solace.
meanings.sent5: The immixture of scents in the garden was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: A mixture of different elements or substances
meanings.sent1: The immixture of spices gave the dish a unique flavor.
meanings.sent2: The immixture of cultures in the city made it vibrant and diverse.
meanings.sent3: The immixture of colors in her outfit was surprisingly stylish.
meanings.sent4: His speech was an immixture of truth and exaggeration.
meanings.sent5: The immixture of sounds in the forest was both calming and eerie.
